org.apache.drill.exec.physical.rowSet

Class TestColumnConverter

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.drill.test.BaseTest
      • org.apache.drill.test.DrillTest
        • org.apache.drill.test.SubOperatorTest
          • org.apache.drill.exec.physical.rowSet.TestColumnConverter

  • public class TestColumnConverter
extends SubOperatorTest
    Tests the column type converter feature of the column metadata and of the RowSetWriter.

    Also tests the set of standard conversions.

    TODO: At present, the set is incomplete. It handles the most common conversions, but others (such as Decimal) are incomplete.

    • Nested Class Summary

      static class  TestColumnConverter.ConverterFactory
      Mock conversion factory that uses a property on the column metadata to indicate that a converter should be inserted.
      static class  TestColumnConverter.TestConverter
      Simple type converter that allows string-to-int conversions.

      • dec

        public static BigDecimal dec(int value)

      • testImplicitConversion

        public void testImplicitConversion()
        Tests the implicit conversions provided by the column writer itself. No conversion mechanism is needed in this case.

      • testImplicitConversionIntTruncation

        public void testImplicitConversionIntTruncation()
        The column accessors provide only int setters. For performance, the int value is assumed to be of the correct range for the target column. If not, truncation of the highest bytes occurs.

        The assumption is, if the reader or other code expects that overflow might occur, that code should be implemented in the client (or in a type conversion shim), leaving the normal code path to optimize for the 99% of the cases where the value is in the proper range.

      • testImplicitConversionIntOverflow

        public void testImplicitConversionIntOverflow()
        Overflow from double-to-int is detected.

      • testImplicitConversionDoubleClamp

        public void testImplicitConversionDoubleClamp()
        Implicit conversion from double (or float) follows the Java Math.round rules: round to the closest long value. Readers that want other behavior should insert a type-conversion shim to implement the preferred rules.

      • testStringToInterval

        public void testStringToInterval()
        Implicit conversion from String to period using default ISO format.

      • testIntervalToString
